channel.title: CVE Feed for Lenovo -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Lenovo -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-40135|2024-08-03T12:14:39.736Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: An information leak vulnerability in the Smart USB Protection SMI Handler in some Lenovo models may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to read SMM memory.

item.title: CVE-2022-3702|2024-08-03T01:20:57.108Z -- lenovo -- vantage%20hardwarescan%20plugin
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Vantage HardwareScan Plugin version 1.3.0.5 and earlier that could allow a local attacker to delete contents of an arbitrary directory under certain conditions.

item.title: CVE-2022-48183|2024-08-03T15:02:36.783Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20t14s%20x13%20gen3%20bios%20-%20windows
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in ThinkPad T14s Gen 3 and X13 Gen3 that could cause the BIOS tamper detection mechanism to not trigger under specific circumstances which could allow unauthorized access.

item.title: CVE-2022-40136|2024-08-03T12:14:39.820Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: An information leak vulnerability in SMI Handler used to configure platform settings over WMI in some Lenovo models may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to read SMM memory.

item.title: CVE-2022-40134|2024-08-03T12:14:39.959Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: An information leak vulnerability in the SMI Set BIOS Password SMI Handler in some Lenovo models may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to read SMM memory.

item.title: CVE-2022-3728|2024-08-03T01:20:57.786Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20t14s%20gen%203%20bios
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in ThinkPad T14s Gen 3 and X13 Gen3 that could cause the BIOS tamper detection mechanism to not trigger under specific circumstances which could allow unauthorized access.

item.title: CVE-2022-48186|2024-08-03T15:02:36.680Z -- lenovo -- baiying
item.description: A certificate validation vulnerability exists in the Baiying Android application which could lead to information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2022-3745|2024-08-03T01:20:58.311Z -- lenovo -- notebook
item.description: A potential vulnerability was discovered in LCFC BIOS for some Lenovo consumer notebook models that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to view incoming and returned data from SMI.

item.title: CVE-2022-3611|2024-08-03T01:14:02.570Z -- lenovo -- app%20store
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability has been identified in the Lenovo App Store which may allow some applications to gain unauthorized access to sensitive user data used by other unrelated applications.

item.title: CVE-2022-3743|2024-08-03T01:20:57.626Z -- lenovo -- notebook
item.description: A potential vulnerability was discovered in LCFC BIOS for some Lenovo consumer notebook models that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges under certain conditions the ability to enumerate Embedded Controller (EC) commands.

item.title: CVE-2022-1891|2024-08-03T00:17:00.926Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A buffer overflow in the SystemLoadDefaultDxe driver in some Lenovo Notebook products may allow an attacker with local privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-3746|2024-08-03T01:20:57.662Z -- lenovo -- notebook
item.description: A potential vulnerability was discovered in LCFC BIOS for some Lenovo consumer notebook models that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to cause some peripherals to work abnormally due to an exposed Embedded Controller (EC) interface.

item.title: CVE-2022-3701|2024-08-03T01:20:57.017Z -- lenovo -- vantage%20systemupdate%20plugin
item.description: A privilege elevation vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo Vantage SystemUpdate plugin version 2.0.0.212 and earlier that could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-3742|2024-08-03T01:20:57.697Z -- lenovo -- notebook
item.description: A potential vulnerability was discovered in LCFC BIOS for some Lenovo consumer notebook models that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code due to improper buffer validation.

item.title: CVE-2022-3432|2024-08-03T01:07:06.699Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability in a driver used during manufacturing process on the Ideapad Y700-14ISK that was mistakenly not deactivated may allow an attacker with elevated privileges to modify secure boot setting by modifying an NVRAM variable.

item.title: CVE-2022-3698|2024-08-03T01:14:03.297Z -- lenovo -- hardwarescanplugin
item.description:
A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo HardwareScanPlugin versions prior to
1.3.1.2
and
Lenovo Diagnostics versions prior to 4.45
that could allow a local user with administrative access to trigger a system crash.

item.title: CVE-2022-4574|2024-08-03T01:41:45.781Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20bios
item.description: An SMI handler input validation vulnerability in the BIOS of some ThinkPad models could allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-48189|2024-08-03T15:10:57.676Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20bios
item.description: An SMM driver input validation vulnerability in the BIOS of some ThinkPad models could allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-4435|2024-08-03T01:41:44.620Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20x13s
item.description: A buffer over-read vulnerability was reported in the ThinkPadX13s BIOS LenovoRemoteConfigUpdateDxe driver that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to cause information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2022-34888|2024-08-03T09:22:10.892Z -- lenovo -- lenovo%20xclarity%20controller
item.description: The Remote Mount feature can potentially be abused by valid, authenticated users to make connections to internal services that may not normally be accessible to users. Internal service access controls, as applicable, remain in effect.

item.title: CVE-2022-34887|2024-08-03T09:22:10.725Z -- lenovo -- printer%20gm265dn%20%28production%20date%20june%202022%20and%20before%29
item.description: Standard users can directly operate and set printer configuration information , such as IP, in some Lenovo Printers without having to authenticate with the administrator password.

item.title: CVE-2022-48181|2024-08-03T15:02:36.753Z -- lenovo -- thinkstation%20bios
item.description: An ErrorMessage driver stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in BIOS of some ThinkPad models could allow an attacker with local access to elevate their privileges and execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-48188|2024-08-03T15:10:58.423Z -- lenovo -- thinkstation%20bios
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability in the SecureBootDXE BIOS driver of some Lenovo Desktop and ThinkStation models could allow an attacker with local access to elevate their privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-4569|2024-08-03T01:41:45.585Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20hybrid%20usb-c%20with%20usb-a%20dock%20firmware%20update%20tool
item.description: A local privilege escalation vulnerability in the ThinkPad Hybrid USB-C with USB-A Dock Firmware Update Tool could allow an attacker with local access to execute code with elevated privileges during the package upgrade or installation.

item.title: CVE-2022-40137|2024-08-03T12:14:39.775Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A buffer overflow in the WMI SMI Handler in some Lenovo models may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-1892|2024-08-03T00:17:00.914Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A buffer overflow in the SystemBootManagerDxe driver in some Lenovo Notebook products may allow an attacker with local privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-3429|2024-08-03T01:07:06.548Z -- lenovo -- printer%20gm265dn%20%28production%20date%20june%202022%20and%20before%29
item.description: A denial-of-service vulnerability was found in the firmware used in Lenovo printers, where users send illegal or malformed strings to an open port, triggering a denial of service that causes a display error and prevents the printer from functioning properly.

item.title: CVE-2022-34886|2024-08-03T09:22:10.644Z -- lenovo -- printer%20gm265dn%20%28production%20date%20june%202022%20and%20before%29
item.description: A remote code execution vulnerability was found in the firmware used in some Lenovo printers, which can be caused by a remote user pushing an illegal string to the server-side interface via a script, resulting in a stack overflow.

item.title: CVE-2022-3744|2024-08-03T01:20:57.610Z -- lenovo -- notebook
item.description: A potential vulnerability was discovered in LCFC BIOS for some Lenovo consumer notebook models that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to unlock UEFI variables due to a hard-coded SMI handler credential.

item.title: CVE-2022-4573|2024-08-03T01:41:45.808Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20x1%20fold%20gen%201
item.description: An SMI handler input validation vulnerability in the ThinkPad X1 Fold Gen 1 could allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-3430|2024-08-03T01:07:06.525Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability in the WMI Setup driver on some consumer Lenovo Notebook devices may allow an attacker with elevated privileges to modify secure boot setting by modifying an NVRAM variable.

item.title: CVE-2022-4816|2024-08-03T01:48:40.490Z -- lenovo -- safecenter
item.description: A denial-of-service vulnerability has been identified in Lenovo Safecenter that could allow a local user to crash the application.

item.title: CVE-2022-3431|2024-08-03T01:07:06.619Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability in a driver used during manufacturing process on some consumer Lenovo Notebook devices that was mistakenly not deactivated may allow an attacker with elevated privileges to modify secure boot setting by modifying an NVRAM variable.

item.title: CVE-2022-3699|2024-08-03T01:14:03.360Z -- lenovo -- hardwarescanplugin
item.description:
A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo HardwareScanPlugin prior to version 1.3.1.2 and Lenovo Diagnostics prior to version 4.45
that could allow a local user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-3700|2024-08-03T01:14:03.243Z -- lenovo -- vantage%20systemupdate%20plugin
item.description: A Time of Check Time of Use (TOCTOU) vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo Vantage SystemUpdate Plugin version 2.0.0.212 and earlier that could allow a local attacker to delete arbitrary files.

item.title: CVE-2022-34884|2024-08-03T09:22:10.816Z -- lenovo -- lenovo%20xclarity%20controller
item.description: A buffer overflow exists in the Remote Presence subsystem which can potentially allow valid, authenticated users to cause a recoverable subsystem denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2022-4568|2024-08-03T01:41:45.731Z -- lenovo -- lenovo%20system%20update
item.description: A directory permissions management vulnerability in Lenovo System Update may allow elevation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-1890|2024-08-03T00:17:00.935Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A buffer overflow in the ReadyBootDxe driver in some Lenovo Notebook products may allow an attacker with local privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-4434|2024-08-03T01:41:44.691Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20x13s
item.description: A buffer over-read vulnerability was reported in the ThinkPadX13s BIOS driver that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to cause information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2022-4575|2024-08-03T01:41:45.637Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20bios
item.description: A vulnerability due to improper write protection of UEFI variables was reported in the BIOS of some ThinkPad models could allow an attacker with physical or local access and elevated privileges the ability to bypass Secure Boot.

item.title: CVE-2022-48182|2024-08-03T15:02:36.729Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20t14s%20x13%20gen3%20bios%20-%20windows
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in ThinkPad T14s Gen 3 and X13 Gen3 that could cause the BIOS tamper detection mechanism to not trigger under specific circumstances which could allow unauthorized access.

item.title: CVE-2022-4432|2024-08-03T01:41:44.772Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20x13s
item.description: A buffer over-read vulnerability was reported in the ThinkPadX13s BIOS PersistenceConfigDxe driver that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to cause information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2022-4433|2024-08-03T01:41:44.572Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20x13s
item.description: A buffer over-read vulnerability was reported in the ThinkPadX13s BIOS LenovoSetupConfigDxe driver that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to cause information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2019-6198|2024-08-02T18:11:26.320Z -- lenovo -- pc%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PC Manager prior to version 2.8.90.11211 that could allow a local attacker to escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2023-5912|2024-08-02T08:14:24.668Z -- lenovo -- notebook%20bios
item.description: A potential memory leakage vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Notebook products that may allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to write to NVRAM variables.

item.title: CVE-2024-38509|2024-08-02T04:12:24.979Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted IPMI command.

item.title: CVE-2024-38512|2024-08-02T04:12:25.173Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted IPMI commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-38511|2024-08-02T04:12:25.141Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in an upload processing functionality of XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.title: CVE-2024-38510|2024-08-02T04:12:24.688Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in the SSH captive command shell interface that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.title: CVE-2024-38508|2024-08-02T04:12:25.569Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in the web interface or SSH captive command shell interface of XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via a specially crafted request.

item.title: CVE-2024-4696|2024-08-01T20:47:41.519Z -- lenovo -- service%20bridge
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Service Bridge prior to version 5.0.2.17 that could allow operating system commands to be executed if a specially crafted link is visited.

item.title: CVE-2024-3286|2024-08-01T20:05:08.381Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was identified in some Lenovo printers that could allow an unauthenticated user to trigger a device restart by sending a specially crafted web request.

item.title: CVE-2024-4786|2024-08-01T20:55:08.718Z -- lenovo -- tab%20k10
item.description: An improper validation vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo Tab K10 that could allow a specially crafted application to keep the device on.

item.title: CVE-2017-3772|2024-08-01T15:04:36.566Z -- lenovo -- pc%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PC Manager versions prior to 2.6.40.3154 that could allow an attacker to cause a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2023-25493|2024-07-31T19:31:26.044Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability was reported in the BIOS update tool driver for some Desktop, Smart Edge, Smart Office, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2024-38509|2024-07-27T17:21:01.331Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted IPMI command.

item.title: CVE-2024-38512|2024-07-27T17:16:58.109Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted IPMI commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-38511|2024-07-27T17:19:56.955Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in an upload processing functionality of XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.title: CVE-2024-38510|2024-07-27T17:20:24.112Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in the SSH captive command shell interface that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.title: CVE-2024-38508|2024-07-27T17:21:36.848Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in the web interface or SSH captive command shell interface of XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via a specially crafted request.

item.title: CVE-2024-23591|2024-07-26T15:09:33.128Z -- lenovo -- thinksystem%20sr670%20v2
item.description:
ThinkSystem SR670V2 servers manufactured from approximately June 2021 to July 2023 were left in Manufacturing Mode which could allow
an attacker with privileged logical access to the host or physical access to server internals to modify or disable Intel Boot Guard firmware integrity, SPS security, and other SPS configuration setting. The server’s NIST SP 800-193-compliant Platform Firmware Resiliency (PFR) security subsystem significantly mitigates this issue.

item.title: CVE-2023-4855|2024-07-09T20:00:42.214Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute unauthorized commands via IPMI.

item.title: CVE-2023-4857|2024-07-09T19:59:02.276Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute certain IPMI calls that could lead to exposure of limited system information.

item.title: CVE-2023-4856|2024-07-09T17:42:49.691Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A format string vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute arbitrary commands on a specific API endpoint.

item.title: CVE-2024-27911|2024-06-20T15:59:08.416Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain the administrator password.

item.title: CVE-2024-27912|2024-06-20T15:57:13.662Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an attacker to cause the device to crash by sending crafted LPD packets.

item.title: CVE-2024-27909|2024-06-20T15:47:17.193Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2024-4696|2024-06-13T20:01:18.145Z -- lenovo -- service%20bridge
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Service Bridge prior to version 5.0.2.17 that could allow operating system commands to be executed if a specially crafted link is visited.

item.title: CVE-2024-2659|2024-04-15T18:00:12.275Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute system commands when performing a specific administrative function.

item.title: CVE-2024-3286|2024-05-16T17:21:21.869Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was identified in some Lenovo printers that could allow an unauthenticated user to trigger a device restart by sending a specially crafted web request.

item.title: CVE-2024-23591|2024-02-20T21:47:49.570Z -- lenovo -- thinksystem%20sr670%20v2
item.description:
ThinkSystem SR670V2 servers manufactured from approximately June 2021 to July 2023 were left in Manufacturing Mode which could allow
an attacker with privileged logical access to the host or physical access to server internals to modify or disable Intel Boot Guard firmware integrity, SPS security, and other SPS configuration setting. The server’s NIST SP 800-193-compliant Platform Firmware Resiliency (PFR) security subsystem significantly mitigates this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-23593|2024-06-04T17:45:57.103Z -- lenovo -- windows%207%20and%208%20pc%20preloads
item.description:
A vulnerability was reported
in a system recovery bootloader that was part of the Lenovo preloaded Windows 7 and 8 operating systems from 2012 to 2014
that could allow a privileged attacker with local access to modify the boot manager and escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-23592|2024-04-05T20:46:20.996Z -- lenovo -- synaptics%20fingerprint%20readers
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was reported in Lenovo devices with Synaptics fingerprint readers that could allow an attacker with physical access to replay fingerprints and bypass Windows Hello authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-23594|2024-04-15T18:01:23.230Z -- lenovo -- windows%207%20and%208%20pc%20preloads
item.description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported
in a system recovery bootloader that was part of the Lenovo preloaded Windows 7 and 8 operating systems from 2012 to 2014
that could allow a privileged attacker with local access to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2024-27911|2024-04-05T20:47:01.657Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain the administrator password.

item.title: CVE-2024-27910|2024-04-05T20:46:55.352Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to reboot the printer without authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-27909|2024-04-05T20:46:46.021Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2024-27908|2024-06-04T17:47:05.996Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-27912|2024-04-05T20:47:09.905Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an attacker to cause the device to crash by sending crafted LPD packets.

item.description: A potential vulnerability were reported in the BIOS of some Desktop, Smart Edge, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to write to NVRAM variables.

item.description: A potential vulnerability was reported in the BIOS update tool driver for some Desktop, Smart Edge, Smart Office, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute unauthorized commands via IPMI.

item.description: A valid authenticated Lenovo XClarity Administrator (LXCA) user can potentially leverage an unauthenticated API endpoint to retrieve system event information.

item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute certain IPMI calls that could lead to exposure of limited system information.

item.description: A format string vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute arbitrary commands on a specific API endpoint.

item.description: An improper validation vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo Tab K10 that could allow a specially crafted application to keep the device on.

item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in an upload processing functionality of XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted IPMI commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-38509|2024-07-26T19:45:01.471Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted IPMI command.

item.title: CVE-2024-4786|2024-07-31T12:32:34.253Z -- lenovo -- tab%20k10
item.description: An improper validation vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo Tab K10 that could allow a specially crafted application to keep the device on.

item.description: A path hijacking vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Driver Manager prior to version 3.1.1307.1308 that could allow a local user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2019-6197|2024-07-31T21:00:05.134Z -- lenovo -- pc%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PC Manager prior to version 2.8.90.11211 that could allow a local attacker to escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2019-6198|2024-07-31T20:30:16.910Z -- lenovo -- pc%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PC Manager prior to version 2.8.90.11211 that could allow a local attacker to escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-3772|2024-07-31T20:30:38.174Z -- lenovo -- pc%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PC Manager versions prior to 2.6.40.3154 that could allow an attacker to cause a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2023-1577|2024-08-01T19:35:25.372Z -- lenovo -- driver%20manager
item.description: A path hijacking vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Driver Manager prior to version 3.1.1307.1308 that could allow a local user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-2659|2024-08-01T19:18:48.140Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute system commands when performing a specific administrative function.

item.title: CVE-2024-27910|2024-08-02T00:41:55.954Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to reboot the printer without authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-27911|2024-08-02T00:41:55.827Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain the administrator password.

item.title: CVE-2024-27912|2024-08-02T00:41:55.749Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an attacker to cause the device to crash by sending crafted LPD packets.

item.title: CVE-2024-27908|2024-08-02T00:41:55.790Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-27909|2024-08-02T00:41:55.786Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2023-4856|2024-08-02T07:38:00.888Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A format string vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute arbitrary commands on a specific API endpoint.

item.title: CVE-2023-4855|2024-08-02T07:38:00.762Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute unauthorized commands via IPMI.

item.title: CVE-2023-4605|2024-08-02T07:31:06.648Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20administrator
item.description: A valid authenticated Lenovo XClarity Administrator (LXCA) user can potentially leverage an unauthenticated API endpoint to retrieve system event information.

item.title: CVE-2023-4857|2024-08-02T07:38:00.772Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute certain IPMI calls that could lead to exposure of limited system information.

item.title: CVE-2023-25494|2024-08-02T11:25:18.856Z -- lenovo -- desktop%20bios%2C%20smart%20edge%20bios%2C%20thinkstation%20bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability were reported in the BIOS of some Desktop, Smart Edge, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to write to NVRAM variables.

item.title: CVE-2023-25493|2024-08-02T11:25:18.371Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability was reported in the BIOS update tool driver for some Desktop, Smart Edge, Smart Office, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.
